input_text:
Job Title: Powder Coat Painter

Location: Mukwonago, WI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Art/Creative, Design, Information Technology

Description:
Super Products LLC is currently accepting applications for our Powder Coat Painter position at our new, state-of-the-art Mukwonago facility.

To apply, click here: Career Site - Self Service (adp.com)

Join the Super Team!

Super Products LLC, an Alamo Group Company, is a growing manufacturing company with a new headquarters in Mukwonago, WI and nationwide rental store facilities. We have been designing and manufacturing high quality vacuum truck equipment since 1973 that include the most innovative features available in the market.

Safety is our top priority. We pride ourselves on creating a safe and healthy work environment where our employees can grow and prosper throughout their careers. We offer competitive wages starting at $22 per hour and a customizable benefits package that begins day one of employment. Take the next step in your career and join a winning team!

The powder coat painter can be assigned any aspect of the process ranging from part preparation to applying the powder. This position requires an individual that is safe and quality conscious.

Essential Functions Of The Job

 Load and unload parts or product onto paint fixtures or carts Prepare material for paint by use of a variety of methods including shot blasting, sanding, and 5 stage washing Mask or plug threaded holes or machined surfaces as required Apply powder following standard operating procedures Set the cure oven parameters following standard operating procedures Perform scheduled checks on the wash system to ensure proper chemistry Perform the proper cleaning and maintenance of painting equipment


Knowledge, Skills And, Abilities (KSA's)

 Experienced in the methods and techniques related to safe use, storage and disposal of powder paint, chemicals, and safe cleanup techniques Demonstrate ability to work independently or in a group with minimal daily supervision and meet expectations  Effectively communicate and understand job instructions both verbally and written in the English language Must be physically fit to wear PAPR equipment Able to use a floor-mounted man lift required


Education And Experience

 High School Diploma or GED A minimum of two (2) years of powder coat painting experience preferred and /or training or an equivalent combination of education and experience


Working Conditions

 Required PPE includes a Tyvek suit and a PAPR hood when painting or shot blasting Work area can vary from wet to dusty depending on the job function being performed Must be able to work in an environment with noise at 75-decibels (25-decibels with earplugs) Must be able to climb stairs and ladders Able to perform work in a non-climate-controlled production environment Must be able to communicate with supervisors and fellow employees  Requires (near, far, depth and color) vision Must be able to be on his/her feet, on concrete, for 90% of their shift  Must be able to lift, push and/or pull up to 50lbs and carry that weight 5ft Must be able to bend, stoop and crouch  Able to work with their arms elevated for periods up to 5 minutes at a time


Relocation package not available for this position

We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, national origin, color, religion, age, genetics, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability or veteran status. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
